data.enText: a feeling of violent anger that is difficult to control
His face was dark with rage.

data.chText: 气愤得发抖 / 战栗 / 说不出话来
data.enText: to be shaking/trembling/speechless with rage

data.chText: 休怒气冲冲地走了出去。
data.enText: Sue stormed out of the room in a rage .

data.chText: 你只要一提起这个话题，他就会暴跳如雷。
data.enText: He flies into a rage if you even mention the subject.

data.chText: （某情况引起的）愤怒，暴力行为
data.enText: anger and violent behaviour caused by a particular situation

data.chText: 超市里一起由手推车引起的暴力事件
data.enText: a case of trolley rage in the supermarket
be all the rage

data.chText: 十分流行；成为时尚；风靡一时
data.enText: to be very popular and fashionable
to show that you are very angry about sth or with sb, especially by shouting

data.chText: 这一切不公正使他大发怒火。
data.enText: He raged against the injustice of it all.
‘That's unfair!’ she raged.

before.enText: of a storm, a battle, an argument, etc.

data.enText: to continue in a violent way
The riots raged for three days.
The blizzard was still raging outside.

before.enText: of an illness, a fire, etc.

data.enText: to spread very quickly

data.chText: 森林大火迅速蔓延，失去了控制。
data.enText: Forest fires were raging out of control.
A flu epidemic raged through Europe.

data.chText: 外出玩个痛快；出去作乐
data.enText: to go out and enjoy yourself

ex.chText: 他听到这个消息时气得浑身发抖。
ex.enText: He trembled with rage on hearing the news.

ex.chText: 她发火的时候不要顶嘴。
ex.enText: Don't answer back when she is in a rage.

synonyms.bx: 指强烈的、难以控制的怒气。

ex.enText: She felt great anger about it.

ex.chText: 对于服务生的傲慢，她拼命压住怒火。
ex.enText: She struggled to control her anger at the waiter's arrogance.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，多指因受到不公平或不友善的对待、顶撞等而引起的愤怒，常后接介词 at。

ex.chText: 得知男朋友平安夜前无法赶回来，她的脸上掠过一丝恼怒的神情。
ex.enText: A look of annoyance crossed her face when she knew that her boyfriend couldn't come back before Christmas Eve.

ex.chText: 让他们气恼的是，她又迟到了。
ex.enText: To their annoyance, she was late again.
Old Green flew into a fury.

ex.chText: 她盛怒之下把信撕得粉碎。
ex.enText: In her fury she tore the letter to pieces.

ex.chText: 谈判细节被泄露给了媒体，令经理大为光火。
ex.enText: Negotiation details were leaked to the press, much to the manager's fury.

synonyms.bx: 指极端愤怒，如大发雷霆、暴跳如雷，常伴有粗暴行为。

ex.chText: 这起污染事件激起了公众的愤怒。
ex.enText: The pollution event generated public outrage.

ex.chText: 该公司无视当地居民对其沿海地区开发计划的愤慨。
ex.enText: The company turned a blind eye to the local residents' outrage at its plan to develop the coastline.

synonyms.bx: 指强烈的愤怒和震惊，常后接介词 at/over。

ex.chText: 她害怕惹母亲大发雷霆。
ex.enText: She was afraid of provoking her mother's wrath.

synonyms.bx: 指极为恼怒，含欲施加惩罚或报复之意。

data.enText: be all the rage

data.chText: 十分流行；成为时尚；风靡一时
data.enText: to be very popular and fashionable

tr: an interest followed with exaggerated zeal
example: he always follows the latest fads
it was all the rage that season
hell hath no fury like a woman scorned
his face turned red with rage
the sea hurled itself in thundering rage against the rocks
she fell into a rage and refused to answer
his rage for fame destroyed him
Rage against the dying of the light!

tr: behave violently, as if in state of a great anger

value.def: Rage is strong anger that is difficult to control.

example.ex: He admitted shooting the man in a fit of rage.
example.tran: 他承认自己一怒之下朝那人开了枪。

value.def: You say that something powerful or unpleasant rages when it continues with great force or violence.

example.ex: Train services were halted as the fire raged for more than four hours...
example.tran: 火灾肆虐超过4个小时，期间列车停止了运行。

example.ex: ...the fierce arguments raging over the future of the Holy City...
example.tran: 关于圣城未来的激烈争论

example.ex: The war rages on and the time has come to take sides.
example.tran: 战乱肆虐，是时候表明立场了。

value.def: If you rage about something, you speak or think very angrily about it.

example.ex: Monroe was on the phone, raging about her mistreatment by the brothers...
example.tran: 门罗正在打电话，怒不可遏地说着她被这几个兄弟虐待的事。
弗兰妮正在屋里大发脾气。

example.ex: 'I can't see it's any of your business,' he raged.
example.tran: “这根本不关你的事，”他生气地说。

value.def: You can refer to the strong anger that someone feels in a particular situation as a particular rage, especially when this results in violent or aggressive behaviour.

example.ex: Cabin crews are reporting up to nine cases of air rage a week.
example.tran: 乘务人员一周内报告的飞机上闹事行为多达9起。

value.tran: （尤指引发暴力或攻击行为的）暴怒,盛怒

value.def: When something is popular and fashionable, you can say that it is the rage or all the rage .

example.ex: The 1950s look is all the rage at the moment.
example.tran: 目前，20世纪50年代的装扮正流行。

trans: 空中愤怒(航班上乘客的攻击或暴力行为)
公路暴怒(司机之间因驾驶问题而大动肝火)

partsOfSpeech.dec: en 使… + rage 疯狂 → 使人疯狂 → 使发怒
out 过分 + rage 疯狂 → 疯狂到了极点 → 暴行
outrage 粗暴；暴行 + ous 有…性质的，关于…的 → 残暴的，骇人的
